byline.contributor: Sewell Chan reported from London, and Milan Schreuer from Paris.
byline.original: By SEWELL CHAN and MILAN SCHREUER

abstract: Belgian police are investigating why warnings by school officials about radicalization of student Bilal Hadfi were not passed on to authorities; Hadfi participated in November Paris terrorist attacks that killed 130 people, blowing himself up outside Paris soccer stadium.
lead_paragraph: The government issued an arrest warrant for Bilal Hadfi, but then lost track of him, Belgian officials said after the Nov. 13 attacks, which killed 130 people.

headline.main: School’s Warnings About Paris Attacker Were Not Passed On
headline.print_headline: Warnings About Paris Attacker Not Passed On

snippet: The government issued an arrest warrant for Bilal Hadfi, but then lost track of him, Belgian officials said after the Nov. 13 attacks, which killed 130 people.
